response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<Animal> it = animalList.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
  i = i + 1;
    names.add(it.next().getName());
}
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new animalList.iterator() in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a JSONObject?: :I have a JSONObject that contains a key called "name". I want to get the value of that key. I tried using JSONObject.get("name") but it doesn't work.
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject(jsonString);
String name = jsonObject.getString("name");
<<<explanation>>>: You can use JSONObject.getString("name") to get the value of the key "name" in the JSONObject.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a JSONArray?: :I have a JSONArray that contains a key called "name". I want to get the value of that key. I tried using JSONArray.get("name") but it doesn't work.
